newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks start higher, volatility possible.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks start higher, volatility possible.

text.p: MADRID, June 19 (Reuter) 0845 GMT - Madrid stocks were up in early trade on Thursday, helped by bond gains and a thin market, dealers said.

Trade may well be volatile, they added, and focus will be on key U.S. data this afternoon and EMU-affecting news from France. * General index opens up 2.18 points, 0.38 percent, to 579.98 * Ibex up 37.22 points, 0.56 percent, to 6,656.92 * Utilities especially strong, still recovering from recent weakness in technically-orientated trade. * Gas Natural up 1.9 pct to 32,010 after shareholders approved a four-for-one share split and after the firm gave analysts a positive outlook in a presentation.
BBV was up 0.8 percent to 11,250 pesetas ahead of the expected approval of a three-for-one share split and a capital increase charged to reserves.
Tabacalera gained 0.5 percent to 7,720 pesetas after Wednesday's shareholders' meeting and the announcement of its purchase of a 20 percent stake in duty-free retailer Aldeasa.
Due later are first quarter current account data from the U.S., as well as the Philadelphia Fed survey.
